leaders.bg: Indiana University Kelley School of Business (Finance). Co-founded Fundfi Merchant Funding. Led company through two credit facility expansions in 2025, Canada market entry in 2024, and two new product launches (loans + credit splits) in December 2025. Driving cross-border financing amid US-Canada tariff dynamics. Also listed on LinkedIn as working at Fundfi Merchant Funding LLC.

Pace University MBA. Previously CIO at Radlett Capital (alternative investments). Former CEO of Dillon Strategic Solutions. Co-founded Fundfi alongside Kandinov, managing financial operations through rapid growth phase including dual product launches and Canada expansion.

news.h: Fundfi Expands Credit Facility for Second Time in 2025
news.d: Fundfi expanded its credit facility for the second time in 2025, positioning the company to serve record numbers of SMBs across North America.

news.h: Fundfi Launches Two New Products — Loans and Credit Splits
news.d: Launched traditional loan financing and credit splits program, providing merchants with multiple pathways to access capital.

news.h: Fundfi Strengthens Cross-Border Solutions Amid US-Canada Tariff Dynamics
news.d: Fundfi Canada Inc. expanded cross-border financial solutions as evolving US-Canada trade relations create new financing needs for businesses.

leaders.bg: 30+ years building businesses. Personally coded FundKite's proprietary daily reconciliation platform. Accepted into Forbes Technology Council in 2019. FundKite has funded $900M+ to 200K+ businesses since 2015 launch. Revenue reached $70M. Just launched manufacturing-specific sales-adjusted repayment model in Jan 2026.

Auburn University, International Business. Former Chairman & CEO of Grove Bank & Trust (2013-2021). Previously President at RK Bank Advisors Group. Promoted to COO at FundKite Sep 2023. Extensive experience in credit, commercial lending, AML, and asset-based lending across multiple South Florida banking institutions.
Decade+ in fintech. Manages ISO/broker channel partnerships. Focused on speed-to-approval as competitive differentiator for FundKite's partner network.
CUNY Brooklyn College. Manages capital deployment and risk at FundKite. Oversees treasury operations for the $900M+ funding platform.

news.h: FundKite Launches Manufacturing-Specific Loan Alternatives
news.d: FundKite introduced cashflow-aligned funding for manufacturers with sales-adjusted repayment, marking entry into sector-specific lending.

news.h: FundKite Reaches $70M Revenue as Fastest-Growing Fintech Funder
news.d: Revenue grew to $70M with 50-90 employees, having funded $900M+ to over 200K small businesses since 2015.

leaders.bg: UC Berkeley graduate. Lifelong entrepreneur and venture capitalist with 30+ years in financial services. Co-founded Vision Capital Advisors (150+ portfolio companies) where he served as CIO & Senior Managing Director (2010-2012). Also founded BRIX Funding for contractor/builder financing. Founding partner at ExSight Ventures (ophthalmic diagnostics VC). Led VOX's $150M Raven Capital credit facility in 2025.

Hofstra University. 25+ years experience. Former President at Aegis Capital Corp. Co-founded VOX Funding in 2018. Speaking on Funder Panel at industry events. Driving company through rapid growth to $750M+ total funded.

Leads technology, data analytics, and marketing at VOX Funding. Built the SYNQ API that powers VOX's integration with Cloudsquare's Salesforce-native platform. Primary technology buyer for the company.
Oversees financial operations at VOX Funding. Focused on ROI and portfolio performance across the company's $750M+ in total funding.
Oversees legal and compliance for VOX Funding's alternative financing operations.

news.h: VOX Funding Secures $150M Credit Facility from Raven Capital
news.d: VOX Funding closed a $150M credit facility from Raven Capital to expand flexible financing options, bringing total funded to $750M+ since 2018.

news.h: VOX Funding and Cloudsquare Partner for API-Driven Capital Automation
news.d: VOX's SYNQ API integrated with Cloudsquare's Salesforce-native CRM, enabling ISOs to submit deals instantly and eliminating manual handoffs.

leaders.bg: Rutgers University. 30+ years in commercial financing. Previously COO and Interim CEO at Marlin Business Services, where he drove 5x origination growth. Leads CAN Capital, the pioneer of the MCA industry (founded 1998) with $8B+ total capital deployed to 85K+ merchants.
Rutgers Business School. CFA charterholder. 30 years in finance. Appointed CFO at CAN Capital in October 2023. Oversees financial operations for the $8B+ deployed platform.
At CAN Capital for 20+ years since 2003. Manages ISO/broker partner program. One of the longest-tenured employees at the MCA industry pioneer.
Columbia University. Previously at Capgemini in Banking & Capital Markets practice. Also worked at Kapitus in business development. Brings consulting and banking technology perspective to BD role.
University of Virginia. Previously at Marlin Capital Solutions and Direct Capital/CIT Bank. Builds and manages partner relationships for CAN Capital.

University of Florida graduate. In MCA industry since 2009. Previously EVP at Merchant Cash Group. Young Entrepreneur Council (YEC) member. Founded Elevate Funding in 2015 in Gainesville, FL. SBFA member working with state and federal regulators. Investing in deepfake detection and compliance monitoring tech (PerformLine). Leadership team has 30+ years combined industry experience.
UF Business Management. At Elevate since founding in 2015. Featured in FunderIntel interview. Also runs Ken Eats Gainesville food blog. Day-one team member who helped build the company from scratch.
Rose through ranks at Elevate from Underwriter to Senior to Manager. Deep knowledge of risk criteria and deal evaluation at Elevate Funding.
Joined Elevate Funding in February 2025. New hire indicates growing underwriting capacity at the firm.

Touro University. Started Velocity Capital Group from a small room in his Long Island home in 2018 after 6 years in MCA. Grew from 1 employee to 18 in under a year. Built network of 40K+ broker relationships. $850M+ in career sales over 13 years. Developed proprietary 'Drag-in' processing software for deal applications via API. Offered crypto funding (USDC, DAI, USDT) starting Aug 2021. Family man who balances business with personal life.
hooks: *Started from home office to 18 staff in 1yr

leaders.bg: University of Maryland. Joined Velocity Capital Group as CRO in August 2024. Previously CRO at Nexi (2020-2024), where he led growth and successful rebranding. Before that, Director at Arcarius LLC (2017-2020). Focused on expanding funding options for merchants and enhancing ISO support.
Drexel University. Previously at Swift Financial and Legend Advance Funding. Drives business development for Velocity Capital Group.
Background at EY and RSM US in accounting and risk. Oversees risk assessment and portfolio quality at Velocity Capital Group.
Baruch College. Digital marketing background. Leads brand and growth strategy at Velocity Capital Group.

news.h: Velocity Capital Group Welcomes Jesse Guzman as New CRO
news.d: VCG appointed Jesse Guzman as Chief Revenue Officer, bringing experience from Nexi where he led growth and rebranding, to scale revenue operations.

leaders.bg: Former Navy SEAL — completed BUD/S training in Coronado, CA, and served 5 years active duty with SEAL Teams ONE and FOUR. BS in Aerospace Engineering from US Naval Academy. MS in Manufacturing Systems Engineering and MBA from Stanford University. 20+ years in banking and payments. Previous roles at Capital One, AccountNow (COO), and founded Ready Financial Group. Named CEO of Rapid Finance in 2015.
hooks: *Former Navy SEAL Teams ONE and FOUR

leaders.bg: 16+ years at Rapid Finance. Georgetown University. Ex-Morgan Stanley. Deeply embedded in the business as one of the longest-tenured executives.
CPA. Duke University economics degree. Co-founded Rapid Finance in 2005. Board-level decision maker who helped build the company to $4.5B+ in total financing.
20+ years in credit risk. Ex-Capital One. UVA economics. Key buyer for underwriting technology decisions at Rapid Finance.

BS in Computer Science from University of Maryland, College Park. Joined Rapid Finance in 2012. Founded and successfully exited two technology ventures prior. Built Rapid's Lynx data automation platform and SPADE AI module. Established software development, business intelligence, and application support departments at Rapid. Extensive full project lifecycle experience in architecting complete software suites.

news.h: Rapid Finance Launches SPADE AI Tool — Cuts Processing Time 95%
news.d: SPADE (Smart Processing and Data Extraction) reduces loan application processing from 20 minutes to 20 seconds using advanced ML for document extraction.

news.h: Rapid Finance Launches Integrated LOS for Community Banks
news.d: Decisioneer LOS now includes one-click access to Rapid's Funding Network, turning bank loan declines into non-interest income.

news.h: Rapid Finance and Gestalt Tech Announce Strategic Integration
news.d: Integration with Gestalt Tech's data warehousing platform gives lenders real-time applicant views and Lynx fraud detection capabilities.

leaders.bg: MBA from University of Western Ontario's Ivey School of Business. Named one of Canada's Top 40 Under 40. Nearly 15-year tenure at goeasy Ltd, including 6 years as President & CEO where he grew portfolio 5x and revenue 3x. Appointed President & CEO of Forward Financing January 2, 2025. Led Forward's inaugural $170M securitization (2x oversubscribed) in December 2025.

12 years as CEO before transitioning to Executive Chairman. Ex-UBS Investment Bank (Associate Director in Madrid, Analyst in NYC), where he advised on M&A for financial institutions. Previously Director of M&A at Watsco, Inc. Boston College graduate. Co-founded Forward Financing in 2012. Also serves as Director at Camp Harbor View.

Appointed CRO at Forward Financing July 2025. 14+ years in fintech. Founding team member at Spring Financial where he spent 11 years, most recently as President & CEO. Under his leadership, Spring Financial grew to 450 employees and nearly 1M annual applicants. Oversees all sales operations at Forward.

MBA from Northwestern University's Kellogg School of Management. Started career as Analyst at Goldman Sachs (2003-2006). Previously Senior VP at Advisory Research, Investment Analyst at Alyeska Investment Group, Associate at Great Hill Partners. Oversees portfolio risk management, business intelligence, and predictive analytics at Forward Financing.

25+ years experience, 15+ in fintech. Joined Forward Financing as CTO February 2024. Previously CTO at Amount and Linear Financial Technologies. Founding member of ODX (OnDeck subsidiary) — built the SaaS digital origination platform with credit, risk assessment, and fraud detection. At OnDeck served as Head SVP, Product & Technology. Oversees engineering, product management, infosec, and enterprise tech.

news.h: Forward Financing Announces $170M Inaugural Asset-Backed Securitization
news.d: The 2x oversubscribed securitization marks a pivotal achievement, providing stable and efficient funding and reflecting institutional investor confidence.

news.h: Forward Financing Welcomes Jason Mullins as President & CEO
news.d: Mullins brings 15 years at goeasy Ltd including 6 years as CEO; co-founder Justin Bakes transitions to Executive Chairman.

news.h: Forward Financing Appoints Tyler Thielmann as CRO
news.d: Former Spring Financial President & CEO joins to oversee all sales operations, bringing experience scaling to 1M applicants annually.

news.h: Forward Financing Wins 5 Built In 2026 Awards
news.d: Recognized across multiple workplace culture categories by Built In for 2026.

leaders.bg: Trial lawyer turned fintech CEO. JD cum laude from University of Miami School of Law. Practicing in Florida since 2003. Won an $11.1M medical malpractice verdict. Co-founded idea Financial in 2017 in a law firm conference room, made first loan Jan 2018. Initially backed with $20M from Warsaw-based Idea Bank, then secured $70M from Cross River Bank. Recently closed $20M corporate term loan from EverBank for expansion into legal lending.

Commercial litigator. University of Florida law degree. Co-founded idea Financial with Leto. Handles operations and strategy. Values compliance and risk management — unusual backgrounds as two trial lawyers running a fintech.
Previously CSO at UpWise. ICE (Intercontinental Exchange) trading floor background. Manages operational metrics at idea Financial.

Rose from entry-level position during COVID to overseeing all sales and marketing at idea Financial. Featured in deBanked November 2025 profile. Known as a face-to-face networker who builds relationships at industry events.

news.h: idea Financial Surpasses $1B in Total Funding
news.d: Crossed $1 billion funded milestone, having served 10K+ businesses since founding in 2017.

news.h: idea Financial Closes $20M EverBank Term Loan
news.d: Secured $20M corporate term loan from EverBank to fuel expansion into small business and legal lending (case financing for law firms).

leaders.bg: NJIT BS, NYU MBA (Entrepreneurial Studies, 2014-2017). Founded Spartan Capital in Middletown, NY in 2015. Bootstrapped to $10M+/month originations with zero VC funding. Capital-efficient operator. Featured on deBanked TV (Ep 55). Profiled by FunderIntel as 'The Spartan Way.' Hudson Valley's #1 small business financing provider.
Appointed April 2025. Previously CFO at Hugo Insurance. Former VP Finance at Fora Financial where they originated $1B+. Understands unit economics deeply.
Appointed May 2025. Previously underwriting manager at Forward Financing. Data-driven approach. Has evaluated AI tools before. Key buyer for underwriting technology.
NYC metro area based. Manages broker/ISO relationships and sales organization for Spartan Capital.
Drexel University. Leads brand and growth strategy. Represented Spartan at Broker Fair 2025.

news.h: Frank Ebanks Profiled in 'The Spartan Way' FunderIntel Interview
news.d: In-depth interview with CEO Frank Ebanks about bootstrapping Spartan Capital to $10M+/month without venture capital funding.

leaders.bg: Brown University BA, Washington University (WashU) MBA. 30+ years in financial services. Co-founded CapFlow Funding Group in 2009 and CFG Merchant Solutions in 2015. Previously at Morgan Stanley, Merrill Lynch, and S&P. Accepted into Forbes Business Council in December 2024. Also attends IFA conferences representing CapFlow.

Appointed 2024 to optimize FactorLOC product. 17+ years in financial services specializing in factoring, PO financing, and consulting. Previously VP of Due Diligence & Underwriting at Capstone Capital Group for 15+ years. Earlier career at Goldman Sachs in Prime Brokerage Operations. Manages risk, compliance, and strategic financial decisions at CapFlow.
Won IFA NEXGEN Rookie of the Year award for outstanding contributions to the factoring industry. At CapFlow since October 2022. Represents company at IFA conferences alongside CEO Andrew Coon.
CFO of both CapFlow Funding Group and CFG Merchant Solutions. Forbes Finance Council member. Controls financial operations across both entities.
CIO of both CapFlow and CFG Merchant Solutions. Previously CEO of AllTrust Networks and COO of Treater. Technical decision-maker for both entities.

news.h: CapFlow Launches FactorLOC Product for Flexible Business Financing
news.d: FactorLOC bridges traditional invoice factoring and lines of credit, offering 40-60% advance rates with 3-6% monthly fees.

news.h: CEO Andrew Coon Accepted into Forbes Business Council
news.d: Coon's acceptance reflects 30+ years of financial services leadership across CapFlow and CFG Merchant Solutions.

news.h: Joseph Spiegel Named IFA NEXGEN Rookie of the Year
news.d: CapFlow Sales Manager recognized for outstanding contributions to the factoring industry.

leaders.bg: Also CEO of CapFlow. Brown University BA, WashU MBA. 30+ years. Previously at Morgan Stanley, Merrill Lynch, and S&P. Most institutional background in MCA space. Forbes Business Council member since Dec 2024.

25+ years in financial services. Villanova University economics. Held institutional trading positions at Lehman Brothers for 13 years (1991-2004) in Fixed Income Division, including senior trader on high grade credit and commercial paper desks. Director in Fixed Income at Barclays Capital heading front-end high grade corporate bond trading. Managing Director at Hudson Castle Group. Accepted into Forbes Business Council December 2024. Co-founded CFGMS in 2015.
CFO since CFGMS founding in 2015. Forbes Finance Council member. Manages financial operations as company funded $500M+ through ISOs in 2024.
Previously CEO of AllTrust Networks. Former COO of Treater. Specialist in launching tech-driven businesses. Technical decision-maker for CFGMS.
Former Team Leader at Bloomberg LP. Daily user of underwriting tools. Evaluates deals hands-on for CFGMS.

news.h: CFG Merchant Solutions Relocates NYC Office to 32 Old Slip
news.d: CFGMS moved from 180 Maiden Lane to 32 Old Slip, Suite 600 in the Financial District, reflecting continued growth.

news.h: CFGMS Reinforces Compliance for California SB 362
news.d: Proactively implemented compliance-ready systems for California's SB 362 disclosure law effective January 2026, preserving fast funding for ISOs.

news.h: CFGMS Ends Q1 2025 with $104M+ in ISO Fundings
news.d: Continued strong growth trajectory with over $104M funded through ISO partners in a single quarter.

news.h: Congressman Dan Meuser Visits CFGMS to Discuss SMB Finance
news.d: Congressional visit underscores CFGMS's growing influence in the regulatory conversation around small business finance.

leaders.bg: Founded Funding Metrics LLC in 2013. Built proprietary risk models combined with real-time cash flow data. Analytics-first approach to merchant cash advance. Parent company operates Lendini and QuickFix Capital brands. Secured $100M revolving credit facility in 2020. $500M+ funded to 9,500+ businesses in all 50 states.
Runs day-to-day operations at Funding Metrics alongside Chairman Frascella. Key operational decision-maker for both Lendini and QuickFix Capital brands.
Works on proprietary risk models and analytics at Funding Metrics. Technical decision-influencer. Deep ML and data pipeline expertise. Part of the Frascella family that founded the company.
Manages ISO relationships for Lendini. Part of the founding Frascella family. Focused on faster approvals through technology for ISO partners.

news.h: Funding Metrics Secures $100M Revolving Credit Facility
news.d: Closed $100M revolving credit facility with a multi-billion dollar institutional credit fund, enabling growth to $500M+ total funded.

leaders.bg: University of South Florida. Co-founded Dynamic Capital in Miami in 2013 (registered as Dynamic Capital of Miami LLC in 2016). Holds both CEO and COO titles, handling strategy and operations. Known for training zero-experience hires into full-cycle funding professionals. DeBanked panelist. Company reached $7.9M revenue in 2025 with 64% headcount growth. Secured $55M debt facility from Mitsubishi HC Capital America in 2023.

Wentworth Institute of Technology. Founded Tip Top Capital circa 2016 in NYC. Personally arranged $400M+ in funding since 2018. Leading strategic expansion into conventional/term lending products. DeBanked panelist. When banks say 'no' to business loans, Tip Top Capital says 'yes.'

Approximately 25-26 years old. MBA from Stony Brook University. Lifelong serial entrepreneur. Profiled by CFO.com for perfecting workplace culture at his Long Island alternative financing brokerage. Founded The Lexington Foundation. DeBanked panelist. Company has ~60 employees with average age ~25. Expanding into real estate via Lexington Estates — first property closing on Long Island with plans to go nationwide within 12 months.

news.h: Lexington Capital Holdings Expanding Into Real Estate
news.d: Launching Lexington Estates to buy, sell, rehab and hold properties, starting on Long Island with plans to expand nationwide within 12 months.

news.h: CFO.com Profiles Lexington's Workplace Culture Under DiAntonio
news.d: Feature article asks whether the Long Island brokerage has perfected workplace culture, highlighting its young CEO and average employee age of ~25.

leaders.bg: 28+ years in financial services. Founded IPI Skyscraper (mortgage brokerage) in 1988, grew it to one of the largest in the US. Founded MortgageIT in 1999, grew it to 2nd largest independent mortgage lender, funded $33B in residential mortgages, took it public on NYSE in 2004, sold to Deutsche Bank in 2007. Served as MD and Global Head of Residential Lending & Trading at Deutsche Bank (2007-2011). Led Deutsche Bank into Shari'a compliant home financing in Saudi Arabia. Founded WBL in 2011.
Oversees Processing, Valuation, Underwriting, and Closing at WBL. 12+ years in real estate investing. Joined WBL in 2021. Key buyer for loan processing technology.
30+ years in financial services. Oversees legal and compliance at World Business Lenders.
Manages referral partner relations and originations. 20+ years in sales. Joined WBL in 2013 — one of the longest-tenured team members.
Senior operational leadership. Oversees administration at World Business Lenders.

news.h: World Business Lenders Announces $250 Million Investment
news.d: WBL secured $250M from its primary financing partner, making WBL majority institutionally-owned. Founder Doug Naidus continues to lead as CEO. Planning additional loan programs and origination channels in 2026.

leaders.bg: Co-founded Credibly (originally Retail Capital) in 2010 with Edan King. Drove growth from startup to $3B+ deployed to 60K+ SMBs. Advocates for generative AI in underwriting. Leading Credibly's AI patent strategy. Management buyout in August 2023.
Co-founded Credibly alongside Ryan Rosett in 2010. Led the August 2023 management buyout. Operational leadership through scaling and rebranding from Retail Capital.
Leads technology and engineering at Credibly. Key decision-maker for AI/tech integrations. Overseeing implementation of patented generative AI underwriting systems.
Oversees financial strategy at Credibly. Important for ROI-based conversations about technology investments.
Chief Strategy Officer at Credibly. Drives strategic initiatives including the Credibly.ai innovation and technology showcase platform.

news.h: Credibly Expands AI IP Portfolio with New Patent for SMB Financing
news.d: US Patent No. US 12,505,113 B2 covers machine learning, deep learning, and GenAI for evaluating affordability, structuring offers, and automating underwriting workflows.

news.h: Credibly Secures First Patent for Proprietary AI Underwriting Platform
news.d: US Patent 12,443,612 B2 covers GenAI with multiple trained multi-class neural networks for underwriting and financing offers to SMBs.

news.h: Credibly Launches Credibly.ai Innovation Showcase
news.d: Technology showcase highlighting AI automation and generative AI use cases in fintech, demonstrating speed of development.

leaders.bg: Co-founded BHG Financial in 2001 with $25K in capital. 40+ years in financial services. Started career at New York Futures Exchange (NYFE) in 1984, later joined an investment banking firm specializing in securitizations. Under his leadership, BHG has originated or facilitated $27B+ in loans. Completed $500M ABS transaction (largest ever for BHG) in August 2025. Joined American Fintech Council in January 2025.
Leads business development, placement operations, bank marketing, national events, and regulatory relations at BHG Financial. Manages BHG's institutional network of 1,650+ banks.
Responsible for safeguarding BHG Financial's interests and reputation by managing and mitigating business risks across a $27B+ loan portfolio.

news.h: BHG Financial Completes Record $500M Asset-Backed Securities Transaction
news.d: Largest ABS transaction in company history, demonstrating strong institutional investor confidence in BHG's loan portfolio quality.

news.h: BHG Financial Joins American Fintech Council
news.d: Crawford cited dedication to providing unparalleled lending options while uplifting the responsible fintech and banking ecosystem.

news.h: BHG Financial Promotes Three Top-Level Executives in Risk and Regulatory
news.d: Doubled down on risk and regulatory leadership by promoting three executives, reinforcing compliance-first approach.

leaders.bg: Built Biz2Credit into a dual-engine empire with billions in active loans and $100M+ ARR. IPO planned for early 2027 with combined valuation approaching $15-20 billion. Built Biz2X SaaS platform generating $100M+ ARR from subscription fees of $1-4M per major client. Total workforce approximately 1,000 with plans to hire 200+ across AI, data science, and engineering.
Heads credit and sales operations with 10+ years of financial services experience at Citibank and Xerox. Brother of CEO Rohit Arora — together they co-founded Biz2Credit.
Driving Biz2Credit's next growth stage in embedded finance, modern lending, and AI-powered fintech.

news.h: Biz2X Plans to Hire 200 Professionals in FY26
news.d: Fintech firm Biz2X expanding team across AI, data science, engineering, and product management roles in India.

news.h: Biz2Credit Approaches $15-20B Valuation Ahead of 2027 IPO
news.d: Profile reveals how Rohit Arora quietly built a dual-engine empire managing billions in active loans with $100M+ ARR, planning IPO for early 2027.

leaders.bg: Nearly 30 years as business owner. BBA and MBA from HEC University in Montreal. Career started in telecommunications — built several businesses from the ground up, made acquisitions, took a company public before selling assets in early 2000s. 20+ years in structured finance, syndication, and M&A. Previously CEO of ONE Bio Corp and founder of Tele Plus World Corp. Acquired what became eCapital in 2010 (then Trade Finance Solutions), rebranded to eCapital June 2020. Named to Inc. 5000 for 3 consecutive years (2023-2025).
Appointed in March 2025 to lead eCapital's growing commercial finance division.
Appointed September 2025. Nearly 20 years of experience driving technology transformation in asset-backed finance and private credit.

news.h: eCapital Secures $388M Conventional Debt Round from Ares Management
news.d: Major debt financing round from Ares Management supports eCapital's continued acquisition-driven growth strategy.

news.h: eCapital Named to Inc. 5000 for Third Consecutive Year
news.d: Third consecutive appearance on the Inc. 5000 list of fastest-growing private companies, validating rapid growth through M&A.

leaders.bg: Longtime CEO of Enova International. Led the 2020 OnDeck acquisition and integration. Transitioning to Executive Chairman effective January 2026 as part of planned succession.

CFA charterholder. Succeeded Fisher as CEO effective January 1, 2026. Enova CFO since joining in 2016. Previously EVP and Chief Risk Officer at Discover Financial Services ($8.7B direct banking). Before that, CFO of Harley-Davidson Financial Services ($7B receivables). Eight years at Capital One in various CFO roles including auto finance ($20B) and banking. Former FDIC bank regulator. University of Alabama BS in Corporate Finance, George Washington University MBA. Board member of AgriBank.
Former OnDeck COO and General Counsel. Now co-leads the Enova Small Business division that includes the OnDeck brand.

news.h: Enova to Acquire Grasshopper Bank for $369M
news.d: Cash and stock transaction to combine online consumer and SMB lending with digital banking infrastructure, projected to boost EPS 25%+ post-synergies.

news.h: Enova Reports $1.4B in Small Business Loans in Q3 2025
news.d: Strong quarterly small business originations through OnDeck and NetCredit platforms.

news.h: Enova Q4 2025 Earnings Beat Estimates, Expects 15% Origination Growth in 2026
news.d: Full-year revenue growth projected at ~15%, with at least 20% rise in adjusted EPS expected for 2026.

leaders.bg: Joined Ascentium Capital in 2014 to launch a direct sales division. Under his leadership, overall origination volume grew from $440M in 2014 to $1.8B in 2022. Succeeded founder Tom Depping as Group Leader following Depping's retirement. Leads the Regions Bank division that has funded $14.1B+ since 2011.

Founded Ascentium Capital in 2011. Led it for over a decade, building it into a premier equipment financing platform before Regions Bank acquired it in 2020. Retired in 2025 after a 40-year career in equipment finance.

news.h: Ascentium Capital Has Funded Over $14.1B Since 2011
news.d: Continued growth as a Regions Bank division, providing streamlined financing for equipment, technology, and commercial vehicles nationwide.

leaders.bg: Led Drip Capital to profitability and $2B+ in annual disbursements (FY ending March 2025). Secured $50M credit facility from TD Bank (plus $25M accordion) in 2025 for North American expansion. Spoke at World Economic Forum in Davos on 'SME squeeze' — pointing to $2 trillion global trade finance gap. Signed MoU with Maharashtra government for Rs 10,000 crore in collateral-free trade finance for MSMEs (2026-2031). Pushing AI-driven 'invisible collateral' approach.
hooks: Maharashtra govt MoU for Rs 10K crore

leaders.bg: Co-founded Drip Capital to simplify trade finance for cross-border SMEs. Company has grown to profitability serving exporters and importers across India and the Americas.

news.h: Drip Capital Raises $50M from TD Bank for North American Expansion
news.d: Credit facility with additional $25M accordion option accelerates cross-border trade finance growth across the Americas.

news.h: Drip Capital Signs MoU with Maharashtra Govt for Rs 10,000 Crore MSME Finance
news.d: Five-year agreement formalized at Davos WEF to provide collateral-free trade finance to MSMEs engaged in exports from Maharashtra.

news.h: Drip Capital Pushes AI-Driven 'Invisible Collateral' for Seasonal Trade Finance
news.d: CEO highlights AI-driven approach to seasonal working-capital lending, addressing documentation gaps and payment cycle uncertainty.

leaders.bg: Founded Knight Capital Funding in 2013, frustrated by industry inefficiencies. Built LenderAI platform to transform commercial lending through AI chatbots and automation. Announced $100M commitment toward AI development. Launched Lendsey AI (borrower- and lender-facing) and LenderAI Prodigy chatbots. Company processes 1,200+ daily loan applications and has processed $7B+ in SBA loans. iBusiness Funding is wholly owned by Ready Capital Corporation.
Leads the Lending-as-a-Service division, helping banks and lenders streamline SBA lending operations through iBusiness Funding's platform.

news.h: iBusiness Funding Launches Lendsey AI and Commits $100M to AI
news.d: First-of-its-kind agentic lending AI solution that augments both borrower and lender sides with instant feedback and work execution.

news.h: iBusiness Funding SBA Audit Shows 0.17% Error Rate
news.d: Independent audit by Doeren Mayhew found just 0.17% error rate with no findings affecting loan eligibility or guarantee status.

news.h: iBusiness Funding Unveils LenderAI Prodigy Chatbots for SBA Lending
news.d: Revolutionary AI chatbot collection originally built for internal use, now available to all LenderAI clients for banks and credit unions.

leaders.bg: Columbia Business School MBA. Founder and CEO of Balboa Capital. After Ameris Bank acquired Balboa Capital in December 2021, Byrne and President Phil Silva joined Ameris. Leads Balboa Capital's operations under the Ameris Bank Equipment Finance umbrella. Company has facilitated over $8B in funding.
Oversees financial operations for Balboa Capital's equipment finance and small business lending divisions under Ameris Bank.

Co-founded Snap Finance before founding Clicklease in 2018. 20+ years in homebuilding and private lending. While running two successful companies, he also worked as an NFL referee and Division 1 college football official. Clicklease focuses on micro-ticket equipment leasing up to $25K with proprietary instant approval algorithm.
Leads operations and growth strategy for Clicklease's technology-driven equipment leasing platform.

news.h: Clicklease Completes $220M Securitization
news.d: First securitization covered 34,000 leases totaling $220M, marking a milestone for the micro-ticket equipment finance company.

news.h: Clicklease Raises $63M Series A Led by Sandlot Partners
news.d: Series A funding to accelerate growth in the commercial micro-ticket equipment finance space.

leaders.bg: Joined TimePayment in March 2018 as COO as part of leadership succession plan. Led record growth and numerous operating initiatives including comprehensive technology and service enhancements. Promoted to President & CEO. Company serves 100,000+ active accounts with transactions from $500 to $500K+.

leaders.t: VP, Point of Sale & Terminal Leasing
leaders.bg: Appointed in 2025 to lead TimePayment's expanding POS and terminal leasing business unit.

news.h: TimePayment Acquires Kingswood Leasing
news.d: Acquired Kingswood Leasing, a leader in restaurant, food services, hospitality and c-store financing, as part of strategy to build industry-focused origination platforms.

news.h: TimePayment Reaches One Million Equipment Leases Financed
news.d: Milestone achievement for the Fortress Investment Group-owned Boston fintech, demonstrating scale in equipment lease financing.

leaders.bg: Originally from Argentina. Stanford MBA. Previously entrepreneur-in-residence at FJ Labs in New York. Earlier career at PayJoy (Growth and Marketing), OLX Group, and BCG (Boston Consulting Group). Founded Mundi in 2020 to simplify cross-border trade. Company has grown non-lending TPV from $3M/month to $14M/month. Raised $38.8M total funding including $15M Series A-2 led by Haymaker Ventures.
Co-founded Mundi to simplify cross-border trade for underserved SMEs. Company expanded beyond trade finance into payments, FX hedging, and cargo insurance.

news.h: Mundi Gains $2.5M Investment for Capital Markets Expansion
news.d: Funding to expand capital markets access for SMEs engaged in cross-border trade.

news.h: Mundi Non-Lending TPV Grows from $3M to $14M/Month
news.d: Dramatic growth in payments, FX, and insurance products beyond core trade finance business.

leaders.bg: Partner at LL Funds. Serves as equity investor and Chairman guiding Quantum Lending's vision and AI-era transformation. Quantum was formed in 2023 through merger of Fundation, Camino Financial, and Amount's SMB operations.

news.h: Quantum Lending Raises $400M in Debt and Equity Financing
news.d: Financing includes $250M warehouse line, corporate debt, and equity to power AI-driven hybrid underwriting platform combining ML and human oversight.

leaders.bg: Founder and CEO of David Allen Capital based in Milford, Michigan. Background includes roles at ACN, General Motors, and Accenture. Featured on the Entrepreneur Spotlight Show (Nov 2025) discussing how DAC and BankBreezy are empowering small businesses. Company reached ~296 employees and $39.7M revenue in 2025. Provides capital from $2K to $2M including lines of credit and instant funding.

news.h: David Rutz Featured on Entrepreneur Spotlight Show
news.d: CEO discusses how David Allen Capital and BankBreezy platform are empowering small businesses with alternative financing.

leaders.bg: Co-founded Marco in 2020 with Peter Spradling, headquartered in Miami with offices in New York and Montevideo. Handles fundraising, talent development, and organizational continuity. Led Marco to provide $250M+ in liquidity to LatAm exporters. Raised $128M total across 7 funding rounds including $12M Series A (Mar 2024). Company addresses $1.5 trillion global trade finance gap for SMEs.
Manages day-to-day business development and operations across Marco's multi-country platform spanning US, Latin America, and Uruguay.

Cryptographer and software engineer with 20+ years experience. Previously Director of Engineering at Ripple Labs for nearly 10 years, where he built and maintained the XRP Ledger codebase and earned 3 patents in cryptography. Later named CTO of Algorand Foundation in Sep 2025. At Marco, led engineering team building cross-border trade finance infrastructure. C++ specialist.

news.h: Marco Closes $12M Series A Led by IDC Ventures
news.d: Funding to revolutionize LatAm SME trade finance, with contributions from IDB Lab, Florida Funders, and Miami Angels.

news.h: Marco Reaches $128M Total Funding Across 7 Rounds
news.d: Continued growth in trade finance for Latin American exporters with proprietary risk models processing real-time data.

leaders.bg: Chairman and CEO of North Mill Equipment Finance with 30+ years of financial services experience. Led NMEF's cultural transformation over the past six years. Pursuing strategy to maximize risk-adjusted returns by building scale and operating leverage through acquisitions. Partnered with Oaktree Capital for $350M FMV leasing JV.
Co-leads NMEF's operations and culture transformation alongside CEO David Lee.
Appointed September 2025. Nearly 20 years driving technology transformation in asset-backed finance and private credit. Also appointed CTO at eCapital around the same time.

news.h: NMEF Announces Strategic JV with Oaktree Capital for $350M FMV Leasing
news.d: Joint venture with Oaktree Capital Management to grow NMEF's fair market value equipment leasing platform with combined capital supporting $350M in originations.

news.h: NMEF Acquires Midland States Bank Equipment Finance Portfolio
news.d: Acquired substantially all of Midland States Bank's equipment finance portfolio, closing November 28, 2025.

leaders.bg: Founded inKind in 2017 with his late brother Rajan Moonesinghe. Raised $450M from Magnetar and Jay-Z's MarcyPen. Ranked No. 40 on Financial Times Fastest-Growing Companies list. Seasoned entrepreneur and angel investor with early-stage investments in Uber, Twilio, and Allbirds. Under his leadership, inKind has funded 6,000+ restaurants providing debt-free, equity-free capital. 4M+ app users. Committed $250M to fund underrepresented restaurant operators.
Leads technology development for inKind's restaurant financing and consumer dining platform connecting 4M+ users to 6,000+ restaurant partners.
Co-founder focused on sustainable and equitable restaurant funding practices. Unique C-suite title in the fintech space.

news.h: inKind Raises $450M from Magnetar and Jay-Z's MarcyPen
news.d: Major capital raise to expand restaurant-focused fintech that provides debt-free capital in exchange for future dining credits.

news.h: inKind Commits $250M to Support Underrepresented Restaurant Operators
news.d: Pledged $250M to fund minority-owned and underrepresented independent restaurant operators by 2025.

leaders.bg: 20+ years building and operating fintechs. Named Supply Chain Finance CEO of the Year. Recognized as Tech Leader by PayTech Awards and FinTech Breakthrough Awards. Founded Raistone and grew it to 80+ personnel across NYC, New Orleans, and Salt Lake City. Crossed $10B in financing with six consecutive years of double Y/Y growth. Ranked #43 on 2023 Deloitte Technology Fast 500. Built invoiceXcel (iX) proprietary receivables finance product.

news.h: Raistone CEO Named Supply Chain Finance CEO of the Year
news.d: Dave Skirzenski recognized for exceptional leadership in B2B embedded finance and supply chain finance innovation.

news.h: Raistone Crosses $10B in Financing
news.d: Milestone reached following six straight years of double year-over-year growth in supply chain finance and invoice factoring.

leaders.bg: Co-founded Kabbage in 2009 with Kathryn Petralia and Marc Gorlin. Named it Kabbage when they found the domain was $73,800 cheaper than 'Cabbage.' Led Kabbage's integration into American Express as Business Blueprint before the brand was retired. After AmEx tenure, co-founded Keep Financial Technologies with Petralia, raised $9M seed round led by Andreessen Horowitz.

Co-founded Kabbage in 2009 and helped build it into a leading alternative small business lender before the AmEx acquisition in 2020. Co-founded Keep Financial Technologies with Rob Frohwein, backed by Andreessen Horowitz $9M seed.

news.h: Kabbage Founders Launch Keep Financial Technologies
news.d: Rob Frohwein and Kathryn Petralia started new fintech Keep, raising $9M seed round led by Andreessen Horowitz.

news.h: American Express Retires Kabbage Brand, Launches Business Blueprint
news.d: Full integration of Kabbage into American Express completed with launch of Business Blueprint for small business lending and cash flow tools.

leaders.bg: Founded Aspiria to bring change to the SME financing space in Mexico. 10+ years experience in financial services in Mexico and internationally. Developed proprietary statistical credit scoring models enabling Aspiria to serve microenterprises and small companies that traditional banks reject. Company has originated 2,300+ loans serving 1,300+ clients with nationwide coverage in Guadalajara, Monterrey, and Mexico City.

Co-developed Aspiria's business model, statistical credit scoring models, processes, and fully digital lending technology from a garage startup in Guadalajara. Series A funded by social impact investor Oikocredit.

Harvard Business School graduate. Previously led growth at Geoblink, a Madrid-based location intelligence company. Spanish founder based in NYC. Co-founded Capchase in May 2020. Raised over $1B in total funding across 9 rounds. Revenue-based financing allows SaaS companies to access 20-70% of future ARR without equity dilution. Company operates from NYC with offices in London, Madrid, and Barcelona with 100+ employees across 15+ nationalities.
Technical co-founder driving Capchase's revenue-based financing platform development.
Co-founded Capchase in May 2020 to help SaaS companies access non-dilutive capital.

news.h: Capchase Secures $400M+ Debt Financing from i80 Group
news.d: Additional debt financing backed by i80 Group and international banking group to support continued revenue-based financing growth.

news.h: Capchase Secures EUR 105M Credit Facility from Deutsche Bank
news.d: Deutsche Bank facility expands Capchase's European lending capacity for SaaS revenue-based financing.

leaders.bg: Over two decades of board and executive leadership experience. Founded Whetstone Group Holdings (WGH), a Woman Veteran Owned business consultancy. Also heads Whetstone Holdings which operates Granite Merchant Funding (revenue-based financing $750K-$2M) and Aspen Invoice Factoring. Sought-after advisor and consultant to nonprofit, private, and public companies.

Co-founded IOU Financial in 2008. 25+ years in financial services including senior roles in wholesale mortgage lending originating $4.5B+ annually. Led the company's 2026 rebrand and digital transformation, including refreshed visual identity and new website. Company has originated $1.9B+ in loans since 2009. Named one of the Top Places to Work in Fintech for 2025 by American Banker.

news.h: IOU Financial Unveils Refreshed Brand, New Website, and Faster Application
news.d: First step in broader 2026 digital transformation with refreshed visual identity, investing in AI/ML innovations for partner tools and borrower experiences.

news.h: IOU Financial Named Top Places to Work in Fintech 2025
news.d: Recognized for workplace culture by American Banker, reflecting strong team environment alongside $1.9B+ in total originations.
